instructions: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat a griddle or non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the griddle for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve with your favorite toppings.
Toast the bread slices until golden brown.
Mash the ripe avocado and spread it evenly on the toasted bread slices.
Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using).
Top with a poached or fried egg and cherry tomatoes if desired.
Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 cup milk (or water for a lighter option)
Nuts or seeds for topping (e.g., almonds, chia seeds)
instructions: In a saucepan, combine the oats, milk, and cinnamon. Bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until the oats are creamy and tender.
Stir in the honey or maple syrup.
Transfer the oatmeal to a bowl and top with fresh berries and your choice of nuts or seeds.
In a glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt, honey, granola, and mixed berries.
Repeat the layers until the container is filled.
Drizzle with almond butter if desired.
Serve chilled.
In a bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add a little butter or oil.
Pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and cook until set, then sprinkle the cheese on top.
Place one tortilla on top of the eggs and cheese, then carefully flip the quesadilla to cook the other side.
Remove from the skillet and cut into wedges.
Serve warm.

ingredients: 1/2 cup frozen berries (e.g., mixed berries, strawberries)
Fresh fruit for topping (e.g., kiwi, banana slices)
Nuts or seeds for topping (e.g., almonds, chia seeds)
instructions: Blend the frozen banana, frozen berries, and Greek yogurt until smooth.
Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
Top with granola, fresh fruit, and your choice of nuts or seeds.
Enjoy with a spoon!
In a large bowl, combine the diced chicken, celery, and red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, Greek yogurt, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the chicken mixture and toss to coat.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve on a bed of lettuce leaves and garnish with tomato slices if desired.
Rinse the quinoa under cold water. In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil and add the quinoa.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes or until water is absorbed and quinoa is cooked.
Fluff the quinoa with a fork and let it cool.
In a large bowl, combine the quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red bell pepper, red onion, parsley, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Pour over the salad and toss to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Spread the hummus evenly over the wrap.
Layer the cucumber, carrot, bell peppers, spinach, and avocado on one side of the wrap.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Fold in the sides of the wrap and roll it up tightly.
Cut in half and serve.
In a saucepan, warm the vegetable broth over low heat.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil and butter over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and saut√© until softened.
Add the Arborio rice and cook for a few minutes until lightly toasted.
If using, pour in the white wine and cook until absorbed.
Begin adding the warm broth, one ladle at a time, stirring frequently. Allow the liquid to absorb before adding more.
Stir in the sliced mushrooms and continue adding broth until the rice is creamy and cooked to your liking.
Stir in the Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

ingredients: 2 cups canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, parsley, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Pour over the salad and toss to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating and slightly overlapping them.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and extra virgin olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.
Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, brown the ground beef and ground pork over medium heat. Drain excess fat if necessary.
Add the chopped onion, garlic, grated carrot, and chopped celery to the skillet. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, red wine (if using), oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for about 20 minutes.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over the cooked spaghetti. Garnish with fresh parsley and grated Parmesan cheese.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried dill, salt, and pepper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the marinade.
Place the salmon on the grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with lemon wedges.

ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., broccoli, bell peppers, snap peas)
instructions: In a bowl, combine the sliced chicken with soy sauce, oyster sauce, and hoisin sauce. Toss to coat and let it marinate for 10 minutes.
Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger and stir-fry for about 30 seconds.
Add the marinated chicken and cook until no longer pink.
Add the mixed vegetables and continue to stir-fry until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Serve over cooked rice.

ingredients: 1 can (14 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (14 oz) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (14 oz) pinto beans, drained and rinsed
Sour cream and shredded cheese for garnish (optional)
instructions: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion, minced garlic, bell pepper, zucchini, and corn. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Stir in the diced tomatoes, black beans, kidney beans, pinto beans, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with optional garnishes like sour cream and shredded cheese.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, snap peas)
Cooked rice or noodles for serving
instructions: In a large skillet or wok, heat the sesame oil over medium-high heat.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger and stir-fry for about 30 seconds.
Add the mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce and hoisin sauce. Pour over the vegetables and toss to coat.
Stir in the chopped green onions.
Serve over cooked rice or noodles.
Toss the beef stew meat in flour to coat.
In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the coated beef and brown on all sides. Remove from the pot and set aside.
In the same pot, add the chopped onion and cook until softened.
Stir in the minced garlic, sliced carrots, and diced potatoes.
Return the browned beef to the pot and pour in the beef broth, diced tomatoes, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for about 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the beef is tender.
Serve hot.
